task.title: Setting a binding
task.shortdesc: A binding is a top level WSDL object that provides a concrete specification regarding the transmission of messages to and from a web service. A binding references exactly one port type. The structure of a binding corresponds very closely to that of the port type. The binding contains extensibility elements (for example, soap, http, and mime) that specify protocol specific details. Each port within a service references exactly one binding.

context.p: You can create a new binding, reuse an existing one, or import one.
To create a new binding for your port, follow these steps:

step.cmd: In the Graph view, right-click your port and click Set Binding.
Select the Create a new binding radio button.
Type the name of the binding in Name field.
step.info: The name should be unique among all bindings defined within the enclosing WSDL document. Click Finish.

step.cmd: In order to see the binding you need to ensure the hide/show binding button is toggled so that bindings are showing.
A Port Type is a named set of abstract operations and the abstract messages involved.
step.info: You can either create a new port type for your binding, reuse an existing one, or import one. Refer to the related tasks for more details.

step.cmd: Type any information about the binding you want the user to read in the Documentation field.

result.p: Tip: You can also create a new binding for your port using the Outline view.

task.title: Reusing a binding for a port

context.p: To reuse a binding for your port, follow these steps:

step.cmd: In the Graph view, select your port.
From the Binding drop down list, select the binding you want to use.
Right-click the binding you want to regenerate.
Specify an required binding information. If you are modifying an existing binding, ensure that you select Overwrite existing binding information.

taskbody.context: To import an existing binding for your port, follow these steps:

step.cmd: In the Graph view, right-click your port and click Set Binding.
Click the Import binding from a file check box. Click Browse.
Select the file that contains the binding you want to use. Click OK.
